Connect to FTP, FTPS or SFTP servers: Connect to FTP, FTPS or SFTP servers
Allow connections to servers with self-s: Allow connections to servers with self-signed certificates
The password to authenticate with. Eithe: The password to authenticate with. Either this or private key is required
The private key to authenticate with. Ei: The private key to authenticate with. Either this or password is required
The host key algorithm to use for SFTP P: The host key algorithm to use for SFTP Private Key authentication
Create a new file in the given path: Create a new file in the given path
Upload a file to the given path.
Read the content of a file.
Deletes a file at given path.
Creates a folder at given path.
Deletes an existing folder at given path: Deletes an existing folder at given path.
Lists the contents of a given folder.
Renames a file or folder at given path.
The path on the sftp server to store the: The path on the sftp server to store the file. e.g. `./myfolder/test.mp3`
The path of the file to delete e.g. `./m: The path of the file to delete e.g. `./myfolder/test.mp3`
The new folder path e.g. `./myfolder`. F: The new folder path e.g. `./myfolder`. For FTP/FTPS, it will create nested folders if necessary.
For SFTP only: Create parent directories: For SFTP only: Create parent directories if they do not exist
The path of the folder to delete e.g. `./myfolder`
Enable this option to delete the folder: Enable this option to delete the folder and all its contents, including subfolders and files.
The path of the folder to list e.g. `./m: The path of the folder to list e.g. `./myfolder`
Depending on the server you can also use: Depending on the server you can also use this to move a file to another directory, as long as the directory exists.
The path of the file or folder to rename: The path of the file or folder to rename e.g. `./myfolder/test.mp3`
The new path of the file or folder e.g. `./myfolder/new-name.mp3`
Trigger when a new file is created or mo: Trigger when a new file is created or modified.
The path to watch for new files: The path to watch for new files
